com.rohitsood.urlybird.util
Class SpringLayoutUtilities

java.lang.Object
  com.rohitsood.urlybird.util.SpringLayoutUtilities
public final class SpringLayoutUtilities
extends java.lang.Object

Utility that helps in the layout of user interface components that use the SpringLayout. Provides a generic way of taking a Container object and creating a form of labels and text fields in a standard grid All spacing and sizing are calculated and set here.

Version:
1.5
Author:
Rohit Sood

Method Detail

makeSpringGrid

public static void makeSpringGrid(java.awt.Container container,
                                  int rows,
                                  int cols,
                                  int x,
                                  int y,
                                  int padX,
                                  int padY)
This method is used to create a grid view for the form. All components in the container are layout as specified in the row and columns. Padding and initial coordinates within the container is provided for embellishments.

Parameters:
container - The container to layout. Component's layout must be a SpringLayout.
rows - The number of rows.
cols - The number of columns.
x - The initial x co-ordinate.
y - The inital y co-ordinate.
padX - The padding in the x-axis among components.
padY - The padding in the y-axis among components.

getPreferredDimension

public static java.awt.Dimension getPreferredDimension(java.awt.Container container,
                                                       int mode)
Calculates the preferred dimension of the component given a mode. It takes the mode based on the mode constants and calculates the preferred size.

Parameters:
container - The container for which the preferred size is to be determined.
mode - The mode for which the calculation takes place.
Returns:
The preferred Dimension of the container.
